Script for in-class activity for lecture 01.

## Ways to Use R

### 1. Arithmetic


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# addition/subtraction/multiplication/division

193 + 45
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 238
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
2050 - 2025
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 25
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
50/250 * 100
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 20
```


:::
:::


### 2. Creating objects

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# vector
# c(..., recursive = FALSE, use.names = TRUE)
x <- c(1:225)
class(x)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "integer"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# matrix
# matrix(data, nrow, ncol, byrow, dimnames)
y <- matrix(1:225, nrow=15, ncol=15, byrow = FALSE)
class(y)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "matrix" "array" 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# logical

over100 <- x>100
table(over100)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
over100
FALSE  TRUE 
  100   125 
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# install.packages("palmerpenguins")
library(palmerpenguins)
data <- penguins_raw
```
:::
